body.p: If the Oxygen AI Positron add-on (version 7.0 or later) is installed, an AI Autocompletion feature is integrated into . The AI Autocompletion feature empowers authors and developers by offering real-time, context-aware code and markup suggestions directly in the editor. As you type, the AI Positron proactively proposes completions, structural fragments, or enhancements tailored to your current editing context (e.g. XSLT, XSD, JSON Schema, Schematron). The goal is to reduce manual typing, speed up coding, and maintain higher consistency.

section.title: How AI Autocompletion Works
section.p: AI Positron continuously monitors what you type in the Text editing mode. When it detects a suitable opportunity, it proposes inline suggestions directly within your editing area. These suggestions may include:

ul.li: Templates and functions for XSLT.
Data type definitions in XSD.
Validation rules for Schematron.
Object and property structures for JSON Schema.

section.p: The suggestions appear subtly inline and can be accepted instantly using a keyboard shortcut.

section.title: Enabling AI Autocompletion
section.p: To enable the AI Autocompletion feature, got to the Smart Autocompletion page within the AI Positron Preferences and configure the following options:

ul.li: Enable Smart Autocomplete - When selected, the AI Positron provides autocompletion context-aware code snippet suggestions based on the current file content and structure.

Model - Specifies which AI model is used for generating autocompletion suggestions. Each model consumes a certain number of credits per token. If no other model is chosen, the gpt-4.1 model is used by default.

Editor Type Selection - Displays a table with all supported Oxygen editors types where AI autocompletion can be activated. Use the checkboxes within this table to select which editors should have Smart Autocomplete enabled.

section.title: Accepting and Using Suggestions

ol.li: Press Tab on your keyboard to accept and insert it into your code.
Continue typing to refine or override the suggestion.
If the proposal is not suitable, simply keep typing and the AI Positron will adapt its next recommendation.

section.p: This design ensures that AI assistance feels natural and unobtrusive, never interrupting your normal workflow.

section.title: Adaptive and Context-Aware Behavior
section.p: The AI engine continuously adapts to your current context:

ul.li: Suggestions automatically adjust as you edit or change nearby code.
The assistant recognizes language-specific syntax and structural rules (e.g. XSLT templates, XSD elements).
The more context it has in your file, the more precise its completions become.

section.p: This adaptability makes it ideal for complex projects where structures evolve quickly.

ul.li: XSLT - Templates, functions, and XPath expressions.
XSD - Schema elements, type definitions, and constraints.
JSON Schema - Object structures, keywords, and property patterns.
Schematron - Rules, assertions, and diagnostics.

section.title: Performance and Optimization
section.p: AI autocompletion runs efficiently in the background. To maintain a smooth editing experience:

ul.li: Suggestions are generated asynchronously to avoid slowing down typing.
Large or complex files may cause a brief delay before suggestions appear.
You can disable or adjust AI auto-completion in the add-onâ€™s Preferences page if needed.

section.title: Customization
section.p: Developers can fine-tune how AI auto-completion behaves:

ul.li: Enable or disable inline suggestions for specific file types.
Combine with other AI Positron features (such as the Generate Code or Explain Code actions) for a richer editing experience.

section.title: Limitations
section.p: To ensure accuracy and user control, the following boundaries apply:

ul.li: AI auto-completion does not generate entire files.
It provides incremental, inline assistance only.
Graphical or visual content suggestions are not supported.
